text.wiki:
Hangzhou Xiaoshan International Airport (IATA: HGH, ICAO: ZSHC) is the principal airport serving Hangzhou, a major city in the Yangtze River Delta region and the capital of Zhejiang Province, China. The airport is located on the southern shore of Qiantang River in Xiaoshan District and is 27 km (17 mi) east of downtown Hangzhou. Architecture firm Aedas designed Hangzhou Xiaoshan International Airport.The airport has service to destinations throughout China. International destinations are mainly in the east and southeast Asia, and points of Africa, Europe, and South Asia. The airport also serves as a focus city for Air China, China Eastern Airlines, China Southern Airlines, Hainan Airlines and Xiamen Airlines.
In 2017, Hangzhou airport handled 35,570,411 passengers, which ranked 10th in terms of passenger traffic in China. Additionally, the airport ranked 6th busiest in terms of cargo with 589,461.6 tonnes and was the country's 9th busiest airport by traffic movements at 271,066.


== History ==
The airport was planned to be constructed in three phases. The first phase of construction started in July 1997, and was completed and opened for traffic on 30 December 2000. It replaced the old Hangzhou Jianqiao Airport, which was a dual-use civil and military airfield. In March 2004, the airport officially became an international airport after immigration and customs facilities were built and put into service. A second runway of 3,600 meters is also under construction. Terminal extensions are also under construction as of 2012.
The airport was a hub of CNAC Zhejiang. After the airlines' merger with Air China, the latter inherited the Hangzhou hub.
KLM launched the first intercontinental air route out of Hangzhou, to Amsterdam, on 8 May 2010.On the evening of 9 July 2010, the airport was shut down for an hour when an unidentified flying object was detected. Air traffic control could not locate it on radar and prudently waved off landing flights. Eighteen flights were affected. Though normal operations resumed four hours later, the incident captured the attention of the Chinese media and sparked a firestorm of speculation on the UFO's identity.


== Facilities ==

Phase One of the airport occupies 7,260 acres (29.4 km2) of land. It has a capacity of eight million passengers and 110,000 tons of cargo a year, and can handle aircraft as large as the Boeing 747-400. It has one runway which is 3,600 metres (11,800 ft) long and 45 metres (148 ft) wide. The passenger terminal can handle 3,600 passengers an hour and is 100,000 square meters in size (including an underground parking of 22,000 square meters). The departure level has 36 ticket counters, including 12 in the international side of the terminal. There are 2,900 seats in the departure lounge. The immigration and customs area occupies 9,500 sq. meter of terminal space.
The apron occupies 340,000 square metres of land, and there are 12 jetways and 18 departure gates.
Maintenance facilities are certified to perform B-Check on all types of aircraft and C-Check on Boeing 737 and Boeing 757 aircraft.
Phase Two of the airport expansion project began construction on 8 November 2007. It included an International Terminal, a second Domestic Terminal, and a new runway. The International Terminal was completed on 3 June 2010. The terminal has 8 air bridgegates, with one gate capable of handling the Airbus A380. All international flights, including flights to Hong Kong, Macau, and Taiwan depart from this terminal. The original terminal handles exclusively domestic flights. All other constructions were completed and operations began on 30 December 2012.The new runway is 3,400 meters (11,200 ft) long and 60 meters (200 ft) wide, which is capable of handling the Airbus A380. The new domestic terminal (T3) has 90 Check-in desks and 21 Self Check-in counters. It also adds 26 security lanes and 31 aerobridge gates. All public spaces of the terminal have free WIFI services. With the addition of the new passenger terminal, the airport now has a total terminal floor area of 370,000 square metres and will enable the airport to handle 8,520 passengers at peak hour and 32.5 million passengers annually.Loong Airlines has its headquarters in the Loong Air Office Building (长龙航空办公大楼; Chánglóng Hángkōng Bàngōngdàlóu) on the airport property.


== Ground transportation ==


=== Airport bus ===
There are airport bus services linking the airport to points throughout Zhejiang and cities in Jiangsu.
Bus services to/from downtown Hangzhou originate/terminate at the Ticketing Office on Tiyuchang Road with intermediate stops in between.


=== Rail ===
There are currently no subway or railway lines that serve the airport. However, two lines on the Hangzhou Metro: Line 1 and Line 7, both of which connect the airport with the city downtown, are currently under construction and are expected to enter operations by 2020 and 2021 respectively.


=== Highway ===
The Airport is accessed by Airport Road, which connects to the Airport Expressway and is linked to downtown Hangzhou by the Xixing Bridge. The Airport Expressway also has an exit at North Shixin Road, which is linked to downtown Xiaoshan. The Shanghai-Hangzhou-Ningbo Expressway has an exit at the airport.

text.wiki:
Hangzhou (Chinese: 杭州; Hangzhounese pronunciation: [ɦɑ̃.tse], Standard Mandarin pronunciation: [xǎŋ.ʈʂóu] (listen)), also romanized as Hangchow, is the capital and most populous city of Zhejiang, People's Republic of China. It sits at the head of Hangzhou Bay, which separates Shanghai and Ningbo. Hangzhou grew to prominence as the southern terminus of the Grand Canal and has been one of the most renowned and prosperous cities in China for much of the last millennium. The city's West Lake, a UNESCO World Heritage site immediately west of the city, is among its best-known attractions. A study conducted by PwC and China Development Research Foundation saw Hangzhou ranked first among "Chinese Cities of Opportunity". Hangzhou is also considered a World City with a "Beta" classification according to GaWC.Hangzhou is classified as a sub-provincial city and forms the core of the Hangzhou metropolitan area, the fourth-largest in China. During the 2010 Chinese census, the metropolitan area held 21.102 million people over an area of 34,585 km2 (13,353 sq mi). Hangzhou prefecture had a registered population of 10,360,000 in 2019.Hangzhou was repeatedly rated as the best commercial city in mainland China by Forbes. As the headquarters of Internet industry enterprises such as Alibaba, Hangzhou has strongly attracted people who work in the Internet industry. Therefore, in the new growing cities that became popular in the 2010s, Hangzhou is one of the main representative cities. Since 2014, the rapid growth of population has caused the rapid growth of local housing prices.
In September 2015, Hangzhou was awarded the 2022 Asian Games. It will be the third city in China to host the Asian Games after Beijing 1990 and Guangzhou 2010. Hangzhou, an emerging technology hub and home to the e-commerce giant Alibaba, also hosted the eleventh G20 summit in 2016.


== History ==


=== Early history ===

The celebrated neolithic culture of Hemudu is known to have inhabited Yuyao, 100 km (62 mi) south-east of Hangzhou, as far back as seven thousand years ago. It was during this time that rice was first cultivated in southeast China. Excavations have established that the jade-carving Liangzhu culture (named for its type site just northwest of Hangzhou) inhabited the area immediately around the present city around five thousand years ago. The first of Hangzhou's present neighborhoods to appear in written records was Yuhang, which probably preserves an old Baiyue name.


=== Medieval history ===

Hangzhou was made the seat of the prefecture of Hang in AD 589, entitling it to a city wall which was constructed two years later. By a longstanding convention also seen in other cities like Guangzhou and Fuzhou, the city took on the name of the area it administered and became known as Hangzhou. Hangzhou was at the southern end of China's Grand Canal which extends to Beijing. The canal evolved over centuries but reached its full length by 609.In the Tang dynasty, Bai Juyi was appointed governor of Hangzhou. Already an accomplished poet, his deeds at Hangzhou have led to his being praised as a great governor. He noticed that the farmland nearby depended on the water of West Lake, but due to the negligence of previous governors, the old dyke had collapsed, and the lake so dried out that the local farmers were suffering from severe drought. He ordered the construction of a stronger and taller dyke, with a dam to control the flow of water, thus providing water for irrigation and mitigating the drought problem. The livelihood of local people of Hangzhou improved over the following years. Bai Juyi used his leisure time to enjoy the West Lake, visiting it almost daily. He also ordered the construction of a causeway connecting Broken Bridge with Solitary Hill to allow walking, instead of requiring a boat. He then had willows and other trees planted along the dyke, making it a beautiful landmark. This causeway was later named "Bai Causeway", in his honor.
It is listed as one of the Seven Ancient Capitals of China. It was first the capital of the Wuyue Kingdom from 907 to 978 during the Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms period. Named Xifu (西府) at the time, it was one of the three great bastions of culture in southern China during the tenth century, along with Nanjing and Chengdu. Leaders of Wuyue were noted patrons of the arts, particularly of Buddhist temple architecture and artwork. The dyke built to protect the city by King Qian Liu gave the Qiantang its modern name. Hangzhou also became a cosmopolitan center, drawing scholars from throughout China and conducting diplomacy with neighboring Chinese states, and also with Japan, Goryeo, and the Khitan Liao dynasty.
In 1089, while another renowned poet Su Shi (Su Dongpo) was the city's governor, he used 200,000 workers to construct a 2.8 km (1.7 mi) long causeway across West Lake. The lake was once a lagoon tens of thousands of years ago. Silt then blocked the way to the sea and the lake was formed. A drill in the lake-bed in 1975 found the sediment of the sea, which confirmed its origin. Artificial preservation prevented the lake from evolving into a marshland. The Su Causeway built by Su Shi, and the Bai Causeway built by Bai Juyi, a Tang dynasty poet who was once the governor of Hangzhou, were both built out of mud dredged from the lake bottom. The lake is surrounded by hills on the northern and western sides. The Baochu Pagoda sits on the Baoshi Hill to the north of the lake.
Arab merchants lived in Hangzhou during the Song dynasty, due to the fact that the oceangoing trade passages took precedence over land trade during this time. There were also Arabic inscriptions from the 13th century and 14th century. During the later period of the Yuan dynasty, Muslims were persecuted through the banning of their traditions, and they participated in revolts against the Mongols. The Fenghuangshi mosque was constructed by an Egyptian trader who moved to Hangzhou. According to Odoric of Pordenone, Hangzhou was the greatest city in the world. It was heavily populated and filled with large family estates. It had twelve thousand bridges. Bread, pork, rice, and wine were abundant despite the large population. Ibn Battuta is known to have visited the city of Hangzhou in 1345; he noted its charm and described how the city sat on a beautiful lake and was surrounded by gentle green hills. During his stay at Hangzhou, he was particularly impressed by the large number of well-crafted and well-painted Chinese wooden ships with colored sails and silk awnings in the canals. He attended a banquet held by Qurtai, the Yuan Mongol administrator of the city, who according to Ibn Battuta, was fond of the skills of local Chinese conjurers.

Hangzhou was chosen as the new capital of the Southern Song dynasty in 1132, when most of northern China had been conquered by the Jurchens in the Jin–Song wars. The surviving imperial family had retreated south from its original capital in Kaifeng after it was captured by the Jurchens in the Jingkang Incident of 1127. Emperor Gaozong moved to Nanjing, then to modern Shangqiu, then to Yangzhou in 1128, and finally to Hangzhou in 1129. The Song government intended it to be a temporary capital, but over the decades Hangzhou grew into a major commercial and cultural center of the Song dynasty, rising from being a middling city of no special importance to being one of the world's largest and most prosperous. Once the prospect of retaking northern China had diminished, government buildings in Hangzhou were extended and renovated to better befit its status as a permanent imperial capital. The imperial palace in Hangzhou, modest in size, was expanded in 1133 with new roofed alleyways, and in 1148 with an extension of the palace walls.

From 1138 until the Mongol invasion of 1276, Hangzhou remained the capital of the Southern Song dynasty and was known as Lin'an (臨安). It served as the seat of the imperial government, a center of trade and entertainment, and the nexus of the main branches of the civil service. During that time the city was a gravitational center of Chinese civilization: what used to be considered "central China" in the north was taken by the Jin, an ethnic minority dynasty ruled by Jurchens.
Numerous philosophers, politicians, and men of literature, including some of the most celebrated poets in Chinese history such as Su Shi, Lu You, and Xin Qiji came here to live and die. Hangzhou is also the birthplace and final resting place of the scientist Shen Kuo (1031–1095 AD), his tomb being located in the Yuhang district.

During the Southern Song dynasty, commercial expansion, an influx of refugees from the conquered north, and the growth of the official and military establishments, led to a corresponding population increase and the city developed well outside its 9th-century ramparts. According to the Encyclopædia Britannica, Hangzhou had a population of over 2 million at that time, while historian Jacques Gernet has estimated that the population of Hangzhou numbered well over one million by 1276. (Official Chinese census figures from the year 1270 listed some 186,330 families in residence and probably failed to count non-residents and soldiers.) It is believed that Hangzhou was the largest city in the world from 1180 to 1315 and from 1348 to 1358.Because of the large population and densely crowded (often multi-story) wooden buildings, Hangzhou was particularly vulnerable to fires. Major conflagrations destroyed large sections of the city in 1132, 1137, 1208, 1229, 1237, and 1275 while smaller fires occurred nearly every year. The 1237 fire alone was recorded to have destroyed 30,000 dwellings. To combat this threat, the government established an elaborate system for fighting fires, erected watchtowers, devised a system of lantern and flag signals to identify the source of the flames and direct the response, and charged more than 3,000 soldiers with the task of putting out fire.
Hangzhou was besieged and captured by the advancing Mongol armies of Kublai Khan in 1276, three years before the final collapse of the Southern Song. The capital of the new Yuan dynasty was established in the city of Dadu (Beijing), but Hangzhou remained an important commercial and administrative center for their southern lands.
Yuan China was very open to foreign visitors, and several returned west describing Hangzhou—under the names Khinzai, Quinsai, Campsay, &c.—as one of the foremost cities in the world. The Venetian merchant Marco Polo supposedly visited Hangzhou in the late 13th century. In his book, he records that the city was "greater than any in the world" and that "the number and wealth of the merchants, and the amount of goods that passed through their hands, was so enormous that no man could form a just estimate thereof." The manuscripts of Polo's account greatly exaggerate the city's size, although it has been argued that the "hundred miles" of walls would be plausible if Chinese miles were intended instead of Italian ones and that the "12,000 stone bridges" might have been a copyist error born from the city's 12 gates. In the 14th century, the Moroccan traveler Ibn Battuta arrived; his later account concurred that al-Khansā was "the biggest city I have ever seen on the face of the earth."


=== Modern history ===
The city remained an important port until the middle of the Ming dynasty era, when its harbor slowly silted up. Under the Qing, it was the site of an imperial army garrison.In 1856 and 1860, the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom occupied Hangzhou. The city was heavily damaged during its conquest, occupation, and eventual reconquest by the Qing army.
Hangzhou was ruled by the Republic of China government under the Kuomintang from 1927 to 1937. From 1937 to 1945, the city was occupied by Japan. The Kuomintang returned in 1945, and governed until 1949. On May 3, 1949, the People's Liberation Army entered Hangzhou and the city came under Communist control. After Deng Xiaoping's reformist policies began in the end of 1978, Hangzhou took advantage of being situated in the Yangtze Delta to bolster its development. It is now one of China's most prosperous major cities.

In September 2015, Hangzhou was awarded the 2022 Asian Games. It will be the third city in China to host the Asian Games after Beijing 1990 and Guangzhou 2010. It also hosted the eleventh G20 summit in 2016.In February 2020, the city was under curfew measures due to the outbreak of coronavirus beginning in Wuhan that spread across China.


== Geography ==

Hangzhou is located in northwestern Zhejiang province, at the southern end of the Grand Canal of China, which runs to Beijing, in the south-central portion of the Yangtze River Delta. Its administrative area (sub-provincial city) extends west to the mountainous parts of Anhui province, and east to the coastal plain near Hangzhou Bay. The city center is built around the eastern and northern sides of the West Lake, just north of the Qiantang River.


=== Climate ===
Hangzhou's climate is humid subtropical (Köppen Cfa) with four distinctive seasons, characterised by long, very hot, humid summers and chilly, cloudy and drier winters (with occasional snow). The mean annual temperature is 17.0 °C (62.6 °F), with monthly daily averages ranging from 4.6 °C (40.3 °F) in January to 28.9 °C (84.0 °F) in July. The city receives an average annual rainfall of 1,438 mm (56.6 in) and is affected by the plum rains of the Asian monsoon in June. In late summer (August to September), Hangzhou suffers typhoon storms, but typhoons seldom strike it directly. Generally they make landfall along the southern coast of Zhejiang, and affect the area with strong winds and stormy rains. Extremes since 1951 have ranged from −9.6 °C (15 °F) on 6 February 1969 up to 41.6 °C (107 °F) on 9 August 2013; unofficial readings have reached −10.5 °C (13 °F), set on 29 December 1912 and 24 January 1916, up to 42.1 °C (108 °F), set on 10 August 1930. With monthly percent possible sunshine ranging from 30% in March to 51% in August, the city receives 1,709.4 hours of sunshine annually.


== Administrative divisions ==
Hangzhou is classified as a sub-provincial city and forms the core of the Hangzhou metropolitan area, the fourth-largest in China. It is the capital and most populous city of Zhejiang Province in East China. IHangzhou comprises 10 districts, 1 county-level city, and 2 counties. The ten urban districts occupy  8,292.31 km2 (3,201.68 sq mi) and have a population of 8,241,000, in which there are six central urban districts and four suburban districts. The central urban districts occupy 706.27 km2 (272.69 sq mi) and have a population of 3,780,000 and the suburban districts occupy 7,586.04 km2 (2,928.99 sq mi) and have a population of 4,461,000.
In the early 90s, the urban districts of Hangzhou only comprises Shangcheng, Xiacheng, Gongshu, Jianggan.
On December 11, 1996, Bingjiang District was established.
On March 12, 2001, the City of Xiaoshan and the City of Yuhang was included into the City of Hangzhou as two districts.
On December 13, 2014, and in July 2017, the City of Fuyang and Lin'an were included into the City of Hangzhou as two districts.


== Demographics ==

Hangzhou city had a population of 5,162,039 (including Xiaoshan and Yuhang) at the 2010 census, an increase of 4.8% per year since the 2000 census. The most recent estimates of the city's urban area population are between 6,658,000 and 6,820,000.During the 2010 Chinese census, the metropolitan area held 21.102 million people over an area of 34,585 km2 (13,353 sq mi). Hangzhou prefecture had a registered population of 9,018,000 in 2015. The entire province had a population of 8,700,373, and the encompassing urban agglomeration (including Shaoxing) is estimated to have population of 8,450,000.The encompassing metropolitan area was estimated by the OECD (Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development) to have, as of 2010, a population of 13.4 million, although other sources put the figure at over 21 million. The Hangzhou metropolitan area includes the major cities of Shaoxing, Jiaxing and Huzhou.


== Politics ==


=== Structure ===


== Economy ==

Hangzhou's economy has rapidly developed since its opening up in 1992. It is an industrial city with many diverse sectors such as light industry, agriculture, and textiles. It is considered an important manufacturing base and logistics hub for coastal China. In recent years, Hangzhou has seen substantial development in its financial sector, featuring for the first time in the Global Financial Centres Index in 2018 at rank 89.
The 2001 GDP of Hangzhou was RMB 156.8 billion, which ranked second among all of the provincial capitals after Guangzhou. The city has more than tripled its GDP since then, increasing from RMB 156.8 billion in 2001 to RMB 1.3509 trillion in 2018 and GDP per capita increasing from US$3,020 to $21,184.The city has developed many new industries, including medicine, information technology, heavy equipment, automotive components, household electrical appliances, electronics, telecommunication, fine chemicals, chemical fibre and food
processing. As the headquarters of Internet industry enterprises such as Alibaba, Hangzhou has also strongly attracted people who work in the Internet industry. A study conducted by PwC and China Development Research Foundation saw Hangzhou ranked first among "Chinese Cities of Opportunity". Hangzhou is also considered a World City with a "Beta+" classification according to GaWC.


=== Economic and Technological Development Zones ===
Hangzhou Economic and Technological Development Zone was established and approved as a national development zone by the State Council in 1993. It covers an area of 104.7 km2 (40.4 sq mi). Encouraged industries include electronic information, biological medicine, machinery and household appliances manufacturing, and food processing.Hangzhou Export Processing Zone was established on April 27, 2000 upon approval of the State Council. It was one of the first zones and the only one in Zhejiang Province to be approved by the government. Its total planned area is 2.92 km2 (1.13 sq mi). It is located close to Hangzhou Xiaoshan International Airport and Hangzhou Port.Hangzhou Hi-Tech Industrial Development Zone was set up with approval from the State Council as a state-level high-tech Industrial Development Zone in March 1991. The HHTZ is composed of three parts, with the main regions being the Zhijiang Sci-Tech Industrial Park and Xiasha Sci-Tech Industrial Park. HHTZ has become one of the most influential high-tech innovation and high-tech industry bases in Zhejiang Province. As of 2013, HHTZ hosts more than 1,100 software developers and BPO enterprises. Major companies such as Motorola, Nokia and Siemens have established R&D centers in the zone. In 2011, the GDP of the zone rose by 13.1 percent, amounting to RMB 41.63 billion. This accounted for 5.9 percent of Hangzhou's total GDP. The HHTZ positions itself as the "Silicon Valley" of China. The Alibaba Group, the world's largest online business-to-business portal and China's largest website in terms of market value, is headquartered in the zone.


== Tourism ==

Hangzhou is known for its historic relics and natural environment. Although Hangzhou has been through many recent urban developments, it still retains its historical and cultural heritage. Today, tourism remains an important factor for Hangzhou's economy. One of Hangzhou's most popular sights is West Lake, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The West Lake Cultural Landscape covers an area of 3,323 ha (8,210 acres) and includes some of Hangzhou's most notable historic and scenic places. Adjacent to the lake is an area which includes historical pagodas, cultural sites, as well as the natural environment of the lake and hills, including Phoenix Mountain. There are two causeways across the lake.
Other places of interest
Grand Canal, also a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The part of the Canal in Hangzhou was built in 610 AD. The core historical sites are accessible by Hangzhou Metro Line 5's The Grand Canal station or East Gongchen Bridge station.
The world's largest tidal bore races up the Qiantang River through Hangzhou reaching up to 12 m (39 ft) in height.
The residence of Hu Xueyan (胡雪岩故居) located on Yuanbao Street was built in 1872 by Hu Xueyan, a native of Anhui, a very successful businessman. It was restored and opened to the public in 2001.
Xixi National Wetland Park. Established with the aim of preserving the wetland ecological system, it covers an area of about 10 km2 (4 sq mi). Fish ponds and reed beds have been restored and it is home to many types of birds. It holds a temple and several historic rural houses.
Hangzhou Botanical Garden
Hangzhou Zoo
Old China Street on He Fang Street (He Fang Jie or Qing He Fang, literally 'neighbourhood along the river'), which offers various souvenirs.
Jade Springs (Yu Quan)
Yuefei Temple A temple constructed during the Song Dynasty in 1221 to commemorate Yue Fei, which is located near the West Lake.
West Lake Cultural Square is one of the tallest buildings in the city centre (about 160 m (520 ft)) and houses the Zhejiang Natural History Museum and Zhejiang Museum of Science and Technology.
Qiandao Lake is a man-made lake with the largest number of islands in Chun'an County, an administrative area of Hangzhou government. These islands are different in size and shape, and have distinctive scene.
Longjing tea fields, west of the lake.
Qiantang riveris the largest river in Zhejiang Province, China. Every year during August 15th to August 18th of the lunar month in China, the Qiantang Tide occurs. It is called “the Biggest Tide in the World”In March 2013 the Hangzhou Tourism Commission started an online campaign via Facebook, the 'Modern Marco Polo' campaign. Over the next year nearly 26,000 participants applied from around the globe, in the hopes of becoming Hangzhou's first foreign tourism ambassador. In a press conference in Hangzhou on 20 May 2014, Liam Bates was announced as the successful winner and won a $55,000 contract, being the first foreigner ever to be appointed by China's government in such an official role.


== Religion ==


=== Scenic places near West Lake ===
Jingci Temple is located just south of West Lake.
Lingyin Temple (Soul's Retreat) is located about 2 km (1.2 mi) west of West Lake. This is believed to be the oldest Buddhist temple in the city, which has gone through numerous destruction and reconstruction cycles.
Baochu Pagoda is located just north of West Lake on Precious Stone Hill (宝石山)
Yue-Wang Temple (King Yue's Temple) or Yue Fei Miao is on the northwest shore of West Lake. It was originally constructed in 1221 in memory of General Yue Fei, who lost his life due to political persecution.
Leifeng Pagoda, located on Sunset Hill south of West Lake.


=== Other religious buildings ===
Liuhe Pagoda or six harmonies pagoda is located on Yuelun Hill on the north bank of Qiantang River
Confucius Temple
Chenghuangmiao (City God Pavilion) located on Wushan (Wu Hill)
Dreaming of the Tiger Spring
The Immaculate Conception Cathedral of Hangzhou is one of the oldest Catholic churches in China, dating back 400 years to the Ming dynasty.
Fenghuang Mosque (凤凰清真寺) is one of the oldest mosques in China, the current construction at the intersection of Xihu Avenue (西湖大道) and the Central Zhongshan Road (中山中路) dates back 700 years to the Yuan dynasty.
Hupao Temple (虎跑寺)


=== Islam ===
In 1848, during the Qing dynasty, Hangzhou was described as the "stronghold" of Islam in China, the city containing several mosques with Arabic inscriptions. A Hui from Ningbo also told an Englishman that Hangzhou was the "stronghold" of Islam in Zhejiang province, containing multiple mosques, compared to his small congregation of around 30 families in Ningbo for his mosque. Within the city of Hangzhou are two notable mosques: the Great Mosque of Hangzhou and the Phoenix Mosque.


=== Judaism ===
As late as the latter part of the 16th and early 17th centuries, the city was an important center of Chinese Jewry, and may have been the original home of the better-known Kaifeng Jewish community.There was formerly a Jewish synagogue in Ningbo, as well as one in Hangzhou, but no traces of them are now discoverable, and the only Jews known to exist in China were in Kaifeng.


=== Christianity ===
Two of the Three Pillars of Chinese Catholicism were from Hangzhou. There was persecution of Christians in the early 21st century in the city.


== Culture ==

The native residents of Hangzhou, like those of Zhejiang and southern Jiangsu, speak Hangzhou dialect, which is a Wu dialect. However, Wu Chinese varies throughout the area where it is spoken, hence, Hangzhou's dialect differs from regions in southern Zhejiang and southern Jiangsu. As the official language defined by China's central government, Mandarin is the dominant spoken language.
There are several museums located in Hangzhou with regional and national importance. China National Silk Museum (中国丝绸博物馆), located near the West Lake, is one of the first state-level museums in China and the largest silk museum in the world. China National Tea Museum (中国茶叶博物馆) is a national museum with special subjects as tea and its culture. Zhejiang Provincial Museum (浙江博物馆) features collection of integrated human studies, exhibition and research with its over 100,000 collected cultural relics.
There are lots of theaters in Hangzhou showing performance of opera shows. Yue opera, originated from Shengzhou, Zhejiang Province, is the second-largest opera form in China. Also, there are several big shows themed with the history and culture of Hangzhou like Impression West Lake and the Romance of Song Dynasty.
Hangzhou has historically been an important hub for artists and scholars. In modern times, Hangzhou was home to the China Academy of Art and prominent painters such as Lin Fengmian and Fang Ganmin.
Tea is an important part of Hangzhou's economy and culture. Hangzhou is best known for originating Longjing, a notable variety of green tea, the most notable type being Longjing Tea. Known as the best type of Long Jing tea, Xi Hu Long Jing is grown in Longjing village near West Lake in Hangzhou, hence its name.The local government of Hangzhou heavily invests in promoting tourism and the arts, with emphasis placed upon silk production, umbrellas, and Chinese hand-held folding fans.


=== Cuisine ===

Hangzhou's local cuisine is often considered to be representative of Zhejiang provincial cuisine, which is claimed as one of China's eight fundamental cuisines. The locally accepted consensus among Hangzhou's natives defines dishes prepared in this style to be "fresh, tender, soft, and smooth, with a mellow fragrance."
Generally, Hangzhou's cuisines tend to be sweeter rather than savoury. Owing to the fact that Hangzhou is located near the Yangtze river, where the climate is mild, the local people enjoy a light diet incorporating river fishes. The rich history of the city provides the local people with stories revolving the origins of local dishes.
Dishes such as Pian Er Chuan Noodles (片儿川), West Lake Vinegar Fish (西湖醋鱼), Dongpo Pork (东坡肉), Longjing Shrimp (龙井虾仁), Beggar's Chicken (叫化鸡), Steamed Rice and Pork Wrapped by Lotus Leaves(荷叶粉蒸肉), Braised Bamboo Shoots (油焖笋), Lotus Root Pudding (藕粉) and Sister Song's Fish Soup (宋嫂鱼羹) are some of the better-known examples of Hangzhou's regional cuisine.
The famous and signature restaurants in Hangzhou include Xin Feng restaurant (新丰小吃), Zhi Wei Guan (知味观), Grandma's Home (外婆家), Green Tea Restaurant (绿茶餐厅), etc. These restaurants create the advanced food and dishes of the traditional Hangzhou cuisine, and combine with the western cooking methods.
Longjing tea is the most famous green tea and rank first among top ten famous teas in China. Those planted by the West Lake is the best Longjing tea.


== Transportation ==


=== Port ===
The Port of Hangzhou is a small river port with a cargo throughput that exceeds 100 million tons annually.


=== Air ===
Hangzhou is served by the Hangzhou Xiaoshan International Airport, which provides direct service to many international destinations such as Thailand, Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, Vietnam, Singapore, Taiwan, Netherlands, Qatar, Portugal and the United States. Regional routes reach Hong Kong and Macau. It has an extensive domestic route network within the PRC and is consistently ranked top 10 in passenger traffic among Chinese airports. Hangzhou Xiaoshan International Airport has two terminals, Terminal A and Terminal B. The smaller Terminal A serves all international and regional flights while the larger Terminal B solely handles domestic traffic. The airport is located just outside the city in the Xiaoshan District with direct bus service linking the airport with Downtown Hangzhou. The ambitious expansion project will see the addition of a second runway and a third terminal which will dramatically increase capacity of the fast-growing airport that serves as a secondary hub of Air China. A new elevated airport express highway is under construction on top of the existing highway between the airport and downtown Hangzhou. The second phase of Hangzhou Metro Line 1 has a planned extension to the airport.


=== Rail ===
Hangzhou sits on the intersecting point of some of the busiest rail corridors in China. The city's main station is Hangzhou East railway station (colloquially "East Station" 东站). It is one of the biggest rail traffic hubs in China, consisting of 15 platforms that house the High Speed CRH service to Shanghai, Nanjing, Changsha, Ningbo, and beyond. The subway station beneath the rail complex building is a stop along the Hangzhou Metro Line 1 and Line 4. There are frequent departures for Shanghai with approximately 20-minute headways from 6:00 to 21:00. Non-stop CRH high-speed service between Hangzhou and Shanghai takes 50 minutes and leaves every hour (excluding a few early morning/late night departures) from both directions. Other CRH high-speed trains that stop at one or more stations along the route complete the trip in 59 to 75 minutes. Most other major cities in China can also be reached by direct train service from Hangzhou. The Hangzhou railway station (colloquially the "City Station" Chinese: 城站) was closed for renovation in mid 2013 but has recently opened again.
Direct trains link Hangzhou with more than 50 main cities, including 12 daily services to Beijing and more than 100 daily services to Shanghai; they reach as far as Ürümqi. The China Railway High-Speed service inaugurated on October 26, 2010. The service is operated by the CRH 380A(L), CRH 380B(L) and CRH380CL train sets which travel at a maximum speed of 350 km/h (220 mph), shortening the duration of the 202 km (126 mi) trip to only 45 minutes.


=== Bus ===
Central (to the east of the city centre, taking the place of the former east station), north, south, and west long-distance bus stations offer frequent coach service to nearby cities/towns within Zhejiang province, as well as surrounding provinces.


=== Public transportation ===
Hangzhou has an efficient public transportation network, consisting of a modern fleet of regular diesel bus, trolley bus, hybrid diesel-electric bus and taxi. Hangzhou is known for its extensive bus rapid transit network expanding from downtown to many suburban areas through dedicated bus lanes on some of the busiest streets in the city. Bicycles and electric scooters are very popular, and major streets have dedicated bike lanes throughout the city. Hangzhou has an extensive free public bike rental system, the Hangzhou Public Bicycle system.


=== Metro ===
The first line of the Hangzhou Metro entered into service in late 2012. with major expansion plans still ongoing. It is the 17th city in China to operate a rapid transit system. In 2018, the state council approved the planning for 15 metro lines, including extensions to the three existing lines, scheduled to open in time for the 2022 Asian Games. By then the Hangzhou Metro network is projected to be 617 km (383 mi) long.The Hangzhou Metro began construction in March 2006, and the first line opened on November 24, 2012. Line 1 connects downtown Hangzhou with suburban areas of the city from Xianghu to Wenze Road and Linping. By June 2015, the southeast part of Line 2 (starts in Xiaoshan District, ends to the south of the city centre) and a short part of Line 4 (fewer than 10 stations, connecting Line 1 and Line 2) were completed. The system is expected to have 15 lines upon completion; most lines are still under construction. The extensions of Line 2 (Xihu District) and Line 4 (east of Bingjiang) were finished in 2018.


=== Taxis ===
Taxis are also popular in the city, with the newest line of Hyundai Sonatas and Volkswagen Passats, and tight regulations. In early 2011, 30 electric taxis were deployed in Hangzhou; 15 were Zotye Langyues and the other 15 were Haima Freemas. In April, however, one Zoyte Langyue caught fire, and all of the electric taxis were taken off the roads later that day. The city still intends to have a fleet of 200 electric taxis by the end of 2011. In 2014, a large number of new electric taxis produced by Xihu-BYD (Xihu (westlake) is a local company which produced televisions in the past) were deployed.


== Education ==


=== Universities ===
Hangzhou has a large student population with many higher education institutions based in the city. Public universities include Zhejiang University, Zhejiang University of Technology, and Hangzhou Normal University etc.  Xiasha, located near the east end of the city,  and Xiaoheshan, located near the west end of the city, are college towns with a cluster of several universities and colleges.

=== Primary and secondary schools ===
Provincial key Public high schools in Hangzhou include Hangzhou No. 4 High School, Hangzhou No. 14 High School, Hangzhou No. 2 High School, Hangzhou Foreign Language School, High School Attached to Zhejiang University, High School attached to Hangzhou Normal university, Hangzhou No. 1 High School and Hangzhou Xuejun High School.
Private high schools in Hangzhou include Hangzhou Green Town Yuhua School, Hangzhou Chinese International School, Hangzhou International School and Hangzhou Japanese School (杭州日本人学校) (nihonjin gakkō).

== Ancient proverbs about Hangzhou ==
An ancient proverb about Hangzhou and Suzhou is:

"Paradise above, Suzhou and Hangzhou below." (上有天堂，下有苏杭)This phrase has a similar meaning to the English phrases "Heaven on Earth".  Marco Polo in his accounts described Suzhou as "the city of the earth" while Hangzhou is "the city of heaven".  The city presented itself as "Paradise on Earth" during the G20 summit held in the city in 2016.Another saying about Hangzhou is:

"Be born in Suzhou, live in Hangzhou, eat in Guangzhou, die in Liuzhou." (生在苏州，活在杭州，吃在广州，死在柳州)The meaning here lies in the fact that Suzhou was renowned for its beautiful and highly civilized and educated citizens, Hangzhou for its scenery, Guangzhou for its food, and Liuzhou (of Guangxi) for its wooden coffins which supposedly halted the decay of the body (likely made from the camphor tree).

Lo que te va a encantar este lugar, es en efecto clásico! Se puede ver la antigua cultura China aquí, bien conservado y hay muchas atracciones en las inmediaciones. visitamos unas cuantas debajo de la agencia de viajes, visitar el parque temático aquí! aunque no es tan grandioso

El sabor de la antigua China, el sabor de la China moderna. edificios antiguos, paseos nuevas! Luego de un gran espectáculo: La leyenda de romance. realmente una gran espectáculo! Antes de cada escena una descripción llega hasta tanto en inglés y chino, que ayuda a conocer lo

Por desgracia la pasamos unos pocos para disfrutar de ambiente de la antigua China en el parque Songcheng. Quizás, visitamos este lugar no es el mejor momento para caminar por el aire, porque fue en enero. Pero fue maravilloso! Era como antigua historia china. Y podemos ver la

Old Fashion espectacular Show ... enorme emitidos y maravillosa historia ... Teníamos dos días acción envasadas en Hangzhou y una de las actividades que era parte de la visita fue tomar en la Dinastía Song Song show en el parque temático. no sabíamos lo que esperar aunque

Es como un parque temático para el turista. el parque está rodeado de murallas del castillo que crea una dinastía realmente Tong sensación y hay gente vístase como soldados y guardias vagando por el lugar en que los caballos, y hay un montón de extrañas actividades como casa

Hangzhou Songcheng, Hangzhou Song (dinastía) ciudad, es un parque temático. En realidad, es una réplica de una ciudad del Song período con restaurantes, tiendas, y un montón de atracciones en las calles. personas vestidas al estilo de Canción pasear, realizar y llevar turistas
lugar impresionante y un espectáculo impresionante. es un muy buen lugar para salir.

Primero de todo, puedes comprar entradas para el espectáculo de la puerta sólo 1 hora y 20 minutos de antelación. Estuvimos allí en buen tiempo y tuvimos que esperar un rato. Todavía había suficiente tiempo para caminar alrededor del parque temático. Había mucho que hacer y se
Parece una película y artificial pero bastante divertido para simplemente pasear y pretende ser parte de un período película. Muchas partes aún en construcción pero estaba bien.

"El romance de la canción" era el nombre del espectáculo se celebraba en este parque temático, que está relacionada con la dinastía Song. El parque temático está bien, y vale la pena pasear por los alrededores, aunque un poco turística, pero el espectáculo es magnífico y no te

El tema es "Dinastía Song". supongo que para ser antiguo edificio estructural, pero no me pareció impresionante incluso como extranjero. Parece ser demasiado activo. entrada es de unos 80 RMB sin los espectáculos. La única cosa que me pareció bastante divertido es el juego

es un parque temático sobre Dinastía Song. El personal en el Songcheng viste qué personas llevaban en la canción. lo califico como promedio quizás es porque soy un. i local no creo que atrae a mí, pero que todavía puede ser un buen lugar para ir a los extranjeros.

This is a list of township-level divisions of the province of Zhejiang, People's Republic of China (PRC). After province, prefecture, and county-level divisions, township-level divisions constitute the formal fourth-level administrative divisions of the PRC. There are a total of 1,356 such divisions in Zhejiang, divided into 375 subdistricts, 670 towns, 293 townships, 4 ethnic towns and 14 ethnic townships, the last two types designated for the She people. This list is divided first into the prefecture-level then the county-level divisions.

text.quote: Water town built on stilts over a system of canals, with traditional wooden homes & stone bridges.
trip: 小镇环境优美，管理到位，住在62民宿，刚一进门老板就送上了一碗凉爽的银耳羹、感觉很好，镇子里的夜景真的很美，白天一般，商业气息浓厚，遗憾的是周一木心美术馆闭馆
一个规划很完善的风景区，很适合待一整天的地方，有古色古香的房屋、美味的小吃，尤其白天的乌镇跟晚上的乌镇，也有不一样的感觉，景色，老少咸宜的地点。

他是委外经营的景点，强烈建议去旅游的人一定要夜宿镇内。 乌镇分西栅及东栅2区，我们此次游玩西栅。 西栅不大发2小时可走完全镇； 食：镇内小吃都不错值得一试，约几位朋友点少份共享，避免排队等候早上10点多就先尝。 住：镇内住宿有沿河岸及对面内部2种，如不怕吵住河岸旁晚上11点多还有喧哗声。 如想照相晚上9点人较少，再晚10点部份熄灯就逊色了，早上6点也是很美8点陆续人多可回住宿补眠。 座船价格不低自行评估，不座也不会后悔，风景在桥上向远处望，小心桥护栏很低。 晚上逛完(指风景看完)留点时间去听说书及旁边露天戏院。
西栅较东栅美丽，同时亦更商业化。你可以视之为一个渡假区，而不是一个自然景点。所以，对我来说，来一趟就够了，无必要重访。 晚上景色迷人，不愧为「中国威尼斯」。其实，她的夜景比威尼斯的更美丽。 西栅的洗手间很特别，如来访西栅，就算不需要上厕所，也必不可错过。
西栅每一处都很干净,每一位西栅人都很友善,让人感到很舒服,各种小吃都很有特色而且很美味,特喜欢梅干菜烧饼、桂花糕、鲜肉棕、乌梅茶
西栅整治的相当不错，厕所很高级，路上几乎看不到垃圾，沿途的小桥流水，就是我心目中的烟雨江南，搭配着两旁的木制建筑，别有一番风味
西栅是乌镇最大的景区，我觉得来乌镇的话来一个就行了，这里的建筑保留得很好，整个景区管理嘚很好没有商业过度，整个景区井井有条，也很干净，物价业很便宜，真是良心景区。景区可以逛的地方很多也有一些有特色的，跟很多古镇不一样，值得再来一次。
乌镇西栅该说是规划完善的水乡主题乐园，然而日间夜里还真的蛮有情调。整座西栅景区的规划理念相当先进，人车分道，对于入住景区内酒店民宿旅客有提供载运行李服务。外环道还有提供电瓶车让行动不便和想省点力的住宿景区旅客运用。
有详细的介绍跟对于古物古蹟的保存，如图片上的还有说明为何会有这称号后面的地方还有道具的介绍，一点都不马虎！
西栅古镇保持很好，而且越夜越美！清晨时宁静。进入景区需要买门票（150人民币）只能一次进出，若是住在景区里也是要买门票，但是可以办人脸辨识，无限次数进出。
去过几次古北水镇，这次来到古北水镇的原型，感觉依然不错，风景优美，商业管理规范，服务周到。唯一需要批评的是，整个酒店禁言管理做的很不好，路上经常有一边行走一边抽烟的人，没有见到有管理人员上前制止，希望能够得到改进。
气温开始回升，十度左右，不需要太厚的衣服了，但是，春天依旧徘徊在不远处。春雨蒙蒙是多见的天气。想看梅花，有，但是景区里面不多。雅园的白马湖边却多得数不过来。赏梅？可以找我哦。
乌镇水鄕太大了，东西南北栅要花三天两夜才能看完，只选择西栅是因为最具代表性，不过也是最多游客出现的区域，据说东栅有中国作家矛盾的故居，南北栅比较朴实。
昼夜各有特色的西栅，比起东栅更加热闹非凡，里面还有邮局可以寄明信片，伴手礼店、茶馆、小吃店应有尽有，晚上还有酒BAR可以进去喝酒看表演，建筑物保留得很完整，连道路都还是从前的石头路，随时都能看见小桥流水人家的景色，要从头走到尾其实需要有点脚力。

联票150，停车费5元12小时内； 内部游船单收费单人60儿童30，大约20多分钟； 看地图行走好于随意闲逛，有定时的戏剧需要留意一下，如梆子戏下午四点开始，错过就没有了！ 里面的大鱼太多了，小鱼苗特别机灵 里面餐厅吃饭实在旅游界良心价，粤菜系一荤两素三碗米饭115元，unbeliveable！ 里面酒店很多，民宿等！ 服务等民风纯朴没有推销拉客行为，游人多可以自己选择，商家都恣意而行，很和谐…… 夜晚的西栅更唯美浪漫，各种灯光映衬下更幽雅静谧. 推荐来看看
乌镇西栅非常适合看夜景，而且晚场门票还有优惠。里面有小桥流水，也有大片的花海，还有各种江浙美食。在里面住民宿晚上别有一番风味
西栅真的真的很不错，整个旅游管理和规划都做得非常好，地面无垃圾，公共洗手间干净，河面无漂浮物，也没有闹哄哄、脏乱差的小吃摊和廉价纪念品店，想吃想喝就在店里吃完再走，基本无外带。累了就找个邻水店铺喝喝小茶，欣赏一下河面上的船来船完，简直是完美人生！！！玩的时候是新春，还有灯会，就是人多了点。
和游人如织的西栅景区比起来，木心美术馆是安静的，这样安宁的美术馆坐落在繁杂的景区之内多少有些违和感，好在它有一座桥，暂时隔开了外面的喧嚣，木心美术馆是我去西栅，也是去乌镇的唯一理由。

overall:虽然以前觉得说是商业化的地方，但是真的去了，还是觉得蛮美丽的~尤其是夜景~ Views:夜景尤其的漂亮，典型的江南水乡~很古朴的赶脚，去的时候是阴雨天，就有点小悲伤，如果让我遇到太阳的话，就可以拍个日出日落啦~ local：当地人怎么说呢，还可以吧~没有坑蒙拐骗的现象~ 被中青旅管理的相当好，很多当地的乌镇老居民部分在东栅，西栅的话大部分都迁出了，除了在景区里面的工作人员。 Services：交通很便利的，从杭州到乌镇，有直接的大巴票，到了当地，下了车，也有短途的BUS直接开到景区，东栅，西栅都是必停阶段，蛮好的说诶~

住在近金沙湖站的莎玛和达（便靓正），搭2个站就会到达客运中心站（食店不多的），买票去乌镇(大巴¥30/每人，建议买定回程票，我当日5点半走就也买不到7点的回程票)，去程75min,落车点旁边就有唯一一个的公车站，车号好似系#350 每人¥2 经东栅....最后到达西栅门口的，可购票(西栅票价为¥120成人&¥60小童)因时间有限（只有大半天）就只选择游览西栅，东西栅联票很贵而且需要时间要充足才能全部游览。 整体不错，值得去! 食店都是小店，食物非常便宜，似妈妈煮的饭。
乌镇去年去了两次，第一次去是参加乌镇的水灯节，乌镇分为西栅景区和东栅景区，其中东栅门票：100 元，西栅门票： 120 元，东西栅联票 150…

乌镇西栅景区游览图看起来很复杂，但实际上慢逛走完全程也不过一天的时间，在这个不大的地方，五脏俱全的拥有着当地人生活所需的各种所设施:邮局、戏楼、书院、纺织厂、制酱作坊等等，古镇内有很多老宅子，每个宅子风格迥异，也都有着各自的故事。 曾看过很多有关乌镇的照片，非一样的色调，非一样的感觉，拍的却是这同一个乌镇，正如一千个人眼中有一千个乌镇，于我而言西栅带给我的feeling：拥有了掌控时间的魔法棒、长生不老的秘诀，历史的车轮不曾停下脚步，但上帝却让这里的时间停止了千年，历经沧桑，却历久弥新。
是因为乌镇音乐节才去的，古镇原来就去过，这次去，感觉更加漂亮，更加有文艺的气息了，非常适合我这种文艺青年，还看了西栅的露天电影，好棒啊
夜景很漂亮，但是要选对时间，慢慢的逛，建议不要选择在旅游旺季，否则人特别多。景区内很多类似咖啡馆一类的，很悠闲，可以进去坐坐
城镇西部比东部大得多，但两者都过于拥挤。可能更有可能在西方找到一个更安静的空间，因为它更大。如果你只有时间看到双方中的一方，那么这个可能就是探索之一，再次因为它更大。然而，如果你正在寻找更真实和更少高档化的东西，那么东方可能会更好，因为西方几乎“太完美”了。尽早来避开人群或在里面过夜。
看到我的评论。乌镇 目前为止最有趣的地区，在西安 Zha 乌镇是，西风景优美的地方。
乌镇是分为中心和dong杭州路杭州路（西）（东部）。 位于杭州路的运河的镇中心。 我建议你来这个地方的游客至少要在这里住上一夜。 一个非常高品质的中式餐厅 - 可能是最好的一个州内杭州路医院坐落在主要街道上的名称。 我会强烈推荐游客去试试。
我给这里评价很好的,因为潜在的,但是不幸的是我们去了当地的一个假期期间。 所以这里非常拥挤。 下午和晚上很晚的时候这里非常非常拥挤和繁忙。 不过这丝毫不会影响晚上灯火通明的河畔建筑的漂亮的场景。 这家旅馆由许多餐厅和小饭馆,几个博物馆和一些安静的公园很宁静的河边或银行。 在西部,寺庙附近的宝塔/? 我们偶然发现了一个漂亮的字段淡紫色的色彩斑斓的鲜花。 很不错。
我发现这里的历史但未能接一个全面的基于丰汇水上的文章最新的旅游景点。 有很棒的餐馆,餐饮和小吃,还有一个有很多很棒的纪念品。 夜晚的灯光很壮观的。
乌镇是一个我见过的最美丽的水乡小镇和一些说它甚至让人想起威尼斯! 住了一个晚上和享受和平和宁静的游客可以有一天离开的时候。 这里的景色也就改变了一个白天和晚上的不少。 坐船是必须的 - 当你在这里就是因为船夫慢慢地经过小镇的游乐设施让你带在沿途的景点。 这里的餐厅食物也不是很贵而且味道很好一般。 尝一下当地的乌镇黄色葡萄酒与您的美食! 添加了一个温暖和李子的味道更好。

我只能说,这是我在中国吃过的最好的牛肚。 这里漂亮的国家,他的的老建筑,和在这里工作的人都很友好,一切都有合理的价格住在园区包括b&b。 强烈推荐住在校园里,你可以看到非常棒的景色,晚上的西栅,灯光Flash传统的中式建筑,无微不至的倒影,就像画Upside River Down。 第二天可以早起,园区Open 7时30分秒前的时候,看到窗外的西栅,没有任何化妆在宁静的早晨,你会感觉你就是中国传统绘画中的景色,美丽的像一个梦。 乘船,茶叶店的茶HAVING Pot River ,除此之外,还有你不能错过它。
这次旅行真是棒极了... 享受美丽的景色,"威尼斯"的建筑和令人惊叹的商店有。
google:
A nice place to visit. But, the best view is in the early morning and night. It's too crowded in the day time. 
So, it's better to stay "inside" of the park (hotel) one night. Then, you can have a quiet and beautiful morning before they open the door for day tour at 9:00 am.

A historic scenic town which is full of Chinese culture. Can be called Oriental version of Venice on the water. Such a different style during day and night. Must try the traditional rowing boat in evening. An awesome place can stay all day long. Quite different scenery in four seasons, I would revisited someday.
The scene is nice but people not kind, never come back this place

text.wiki:
Longjing (simplified Chinese: 龙井; traditional Chinese: 龍井; pinyin: Lóngjǐng), literally "dragon well", is a name applied to a number of locations and products from the southwestern region of the city of Hangzhou in Zhejiang province, China. Most notably, the name refers to the titular Dragon Well itself, located near Longjing village (simplified Chinese: 龙井村; traditional Chinese: 龍井村; pinyin: lóngjǐng cūn) in Xihu District, as well as the area encompassing the well and the Longjing tea famously grown there.
The Dragon Well region consists of a number of villages, tea plantations, tea houses, parks, and a temple. The area is popular for drinking and buying tea as well as visiting the Eight Scenes of the Dragon Well (龙井八景).


== External links ==
The Tea Fields of Longjing
trip: 身心清爽。真是很好的体验。在这种环境下生活，壹定比城市里面活得更久吧，山好水好，茶更好。时不时的享受着大自然的新鲜空气，放眼望去，壹片皆绿，爽哉。
都说“龙井茶叶虎跑水”，其实，龙井的泉水也非常有名。 龙井，是寺名，更是泉名，它是西湖古老的名泉，涓涓细流、清澈见底、汨汨潺潺、甘甜香冽。龙井虽溪水资源丰富，但井水独自系统，至井边，用小木棍搅动，稍亭后，会有一条奇妙的水纹线，被人称作“龙须”。 龙井寺是相传古老的寺庙，与道家仙翁葛玄、葛洪，北宋的辩才法师、苏轼、苏辙、秦观对此都有很深的渊源，均为当时和后人所称道。
杭州龙井山园茶文化村很有意思。 我们是包车的司机推荐来的，这里可以品茶，看茶园，当然可以购物，买到当季的好茶叶，挺适合全家出游。
在西湖的西南方向，被一日游的车拉过来的，被邀请品茶，并讲解了茶历史和茶文化，也可以现场买茶，都是著名的龙井茶，大片的茶园很养眼
杭州这边自然是有当地的茶文化，龙井也很出名，这个茶文化园很不错，里面觉得茶香四溢的。除了有专人跟你讲解相关知识，也有茶可以品尝。
这个地方不太好找，找到之后就会有一种豁然开朗的感觉，路的两遍能看到大片大片的茶园，在村里家家户户的门前都摆着刚制作的好新鲜茶叶，也可以现场泡一壶品一品。
周末去龙井村的农家乐喝茶吃饭，这儿的茶叶都是当地农民自己种的，也是龙井茶的产地，地处山顶，处处是风景，吃饭后还可以爬爬山，周末休闲的好去处。
GPS指错了路，误打误撞来到了这里。早晨轻雾缭绕，美如仙境，可惜匆匆而过，没来得及品尝一杯正宗西湖龙井。建议来这里半天，休闲放松，边赏茶山边品香茗。
这里龙井园茶文化村类似农家乐的性质，在杭州郊区，来的人不多，大多是旅游团带过来，散客比较少，景色不错，可以品龙井茶，香气四溢。买的话价格挺高的。
龙井茶名声在外，这次来到它的老家探访。沿着路直上，两边都是茂密的茶树，绿油油又娇滴滴的，江南风情甚好。到了山上，品一口优质龙井茶，感觉太棒了。这里就是茶文化产业化、形成产业链的一种最好的体现。人走茶不凉。
这个相对于杭州市其他景区而言，是个不错的地方，由于具有一定的海拔高度，山内空气清新，当车子开到半山时，微风扑面而来，令人心旷神怡。也可以到山顶的一些茶室，去品茶，或购买龙井茶，记得要还价喔。由于时间有限，呆的时间短了点，有机会再去，听说是杭州当地人的休闲之地。
在这里的茶园 可以亲眼看见采摘茶叶的过程 茶农们还邀请我们去他们家品茶 介绍了好多种茶叶 不买都 没关系 可以慢慢细品 听他们介绍各种茶 还有杭州文化 还去了龙井 打捞井水洗手
嗯.基本上而言.在买茶的过程中.没有感到压迫感.店家很亲切.一直请喝茶.不过因为店家真的不少.所以还是要多多比较才好.因为.出发之前.在网路上做过功课.对价格.有一定程度了解.还好没有买贵了.
这个茶园在郊区的山上，来的时候以为是喝喝茶、买买茶的地方，到了竟然还有表演！当是一定要注意，说的门票是免费的，但是一旦人家给表演就代表你得消费了。里面还有好几个景点，八大景点。景色很不存，很有返璞归真的感觉。
下了一路雨，路也挺不好走还好穿了冲锋衣，风景真的不错哦景区还是免费的顺路还能在龙井村喝点正宗龙井茶真是很爽哦
龙井比较适合周末去喝茶打牌聊天消磨时光，下午太阳晒晒过过慵懒的时光很是惬意！买茶的话不是很推荐去，容易被宰！不过如果自己觉得有辨别能力的话去品鉴品鉴也不错！
骑车从杨公堤一路骑车过来 很累 但风景很好 路两旁都是茶园 风景很好 路上很多杭州人过来玩 有车自驾过来挺好 自己骑车还是太累了，不过还是很值的
在这里细味龙井茶，感受周边的宁静是非常写意的。龙井村感觉远离烦嚣，散散心是不错的选择。里面有一家酒店我忘记名字了，但是吃的东西相当精致，冰镇苦瓜、鱼片之类的。二楼是抽象艺术风格，挂的壁画或布置都很有意思。来是因为公务，但选这个地方简直对极了！
强烈推荐大家宁可不去西湖，也要到茶园看看，可以亲手采摘茶叶，非常有趣...景色和空气令人心旷神怡啊！满眼的绿色令人难忘！如果是春季前来感受会另有一番情趣...关键是游客比起西湖来少了很多，很舒服的感觉！
龙井在杭州的深山里，几乎没有人，城市里的农村~茶树是四季常青的，所以即使是冬天，龙井附近也是满眼的绿色~不过不太建议大家买哪里的龙井茶，太贵了。。。
山上没有了城市的喧闹能够让我彻底的放松，空气的味道很清新，好像闻到了生命的气息。羡慕住在这里的人们，远离了污染，亲近了自然。
那里的老龙井，不知道水是否有什么祈福保佑的作用，每个去的人都会打一桶水洗手洗脸。那里的八小孩很优秀，不过这也可能更要归功于他们有陶行知这样的老师吧。那里的人很热情，微冷的小雨中走进农家品一杯龙井茶也不错！
过年去的，刚好下过了一场雪，我们赶山第一批上山，雪地基本上还没被人踩过！里面幽静的环境很让人平静舒心！配上龙井茶真是绝妙！哈！
在杭州的龙井村里有条道叫九溪十八弯是当年乾隆帝走过的路，静静且清澈的溪流，两旁高大的松树，避开了太阳的直射，走在哪条小路上你的心情也会跟着放松清爽，听说杭州的老人都很喜欢去那里散步，有机会你们也一定要去那里走走哦！
已经有些商业化了。之前听说的时候搞的很农家乐的。现在价格有些偏高了，毕竟又包装神马的。但是还是要买1斤以上这样的（我和同学一起买了1斤被老板鄙视）。
交通非常方便，公交车27路坐到底就可以了，路上还能看看西湖风光。没什么很特别的风景，但是身处茶山之中，空气质量还是不错的。当地的农家经过几年的经营，已经很商业化了，上菜速度什么的都没问题。不过要想喝到真正的西湖龙井或者想吃真正的山里货，是不可能的了。
去时已是六月份了，据当地的茶农讲，好茶已采摘完了。而且很多好的茶叶都已炒完上市了。茶农很热情，很多人自己家里都有茶园，在老乡那里购买了一些茶农自己留着喝的早春茶，不错。如果想去当时购茶，最好在四月份时过去，能喝到很地道的。。。
青山绿水 茶树遍野 惬意的小丛 弯弯曲曲盘蜒的山路 适合约三两好友 走走停停 听世代茶农讲一讲十八御茶的故事 去到农家小院品一品雨前龙井 美事一桩
去过杭州的人一般的少不了游西湖，在西湖的边上有一片茶园，那里所产的茶叶就是西湖龙井了，在茶园的旁边有一处据说卖的全部都是正品的丝绸庄，叫什么名我给忘了，一打听都知道，不打听当地的人也会很热情的主动的给你介绍，但真丝的价格不低哦。
杭州就是景好，走在西湖边那空气，赞啊，是个很适合居住的城市，有闲暇时间可以考虑来杭州走上一圈，特别是品下西湖龙井，茶香，味醇！
是一个适合全家人来的地方，汇聚各地风味的茶食小吃街，演艺广场，赛狗斗鸡表演，民间杂艺表演，十多种参与性游乐项目。

因为走错路，我和朋友上十里琅珰走的是茶农走的路。一路上热情的茶农还为我俩之路。雨前茶已经被采得差不多了，偶见几片茶叶留在枝头，我就忍不住摘下来放在嘴里咀嚼回味，苦味加淡淡的清香，慰藉一路的辛劳。 上了山坡，往回望，是满眼的绿色和山谷里黑瓦白墙的人家。清风拂面，像是要把一切的尘土带走。龙井村里几乎每家每户都炒茶，茶香四溢。要不是太多的人来这里“搅扰”，这里的时光定要更加安宁。试想午后一杯绿茶在手，或一卷书，或一盘棋，消磨一个下午，该是怎样的乐事。
很好，非常好，值得一去，有很好的自然风光，和人文风光，还可以，去农户家里品尝聊天。推荐大家去杭州的时候一定要去这里。
在这里品尝真正的西湖龙井，这里的买茶女会向你推广龙井茶的由来及种植技术等等，而且最吸引我的是龙井是用春茶做的，不会用化肥及农药，这个我比较关心。所以买了80%嫩芽的龙井。价格有点贵，但喝着放心。
杭州龙井山园茶文化村位于半山腰 回头望去 西湖 就像一颗宝石镶嵌在繁华的杭州市 古香古色又现代气息十足 山茶 龙井 采茶人 炒茶师傅 还有龙井 还有很方便的公交 曲曲折折的山路 流连忘返
杭州，一个繁华的都市，虽然不大但也是中国比较发达的城市，我们都知道杭州西湖景色很美，在喧嚣的都市中倒映出一道美丽的风景线~这些大家都知道!说道龙井，你可能听说过但未曾去过，，那是一个隐藏在大城市里面的世外桃源~~优美的山水景色让你心情舒畅~~再倒一杯浓香的西湖龙井茶绝对让你留恋往返~！
在苏堤附近车站遇见闲逛的大妈，看起来很敦厚实质上一直在忽悠你上龙井。最可恶的是居然为了让人去故意指错路。。。告诉你你要去的地方就在龙井附近走几分钟就到，实质上可能要一个小时。。。然后会有另外的人接力，想方法说自己跟你很有缘让你上她家喝茶。。。去了以后再各种忽悠你买茶。。。完全颠覆我对农民敦厚诚实的印象。。。 现在的龙井完全不值得游客游玩了
每次到杭州，必去龙井。而且往往喜欢选择从九溪十八涧那边上山的一条路，本地人多熟悉这样的小路，因为可以穿过很多个景点。从九溪一路攀爬，沿途满满的全是茶园，在傍晚的时候尤其深幽静远。过了十八涧，也就到达了龙井村的后门。经过了一路的跋涉，这个时候做在满目苍翠的小村庄里，听溪水潺潺，品一杯香茗，西湖风情尽溶于杯中。
09年借着出差的机会去了杭州，当地分公司的同事接待了我们。周六开车前往龙井村，吃了农家饭。茶农带我们免费参观了景点，看了最正宗的龙井。农家饭很好吃很好吃，喜欢真是个好地方，虽然去过西湖好多次了，但是都没有真正游全，以后要带上小孩再来这个美丽的地方
初次见到茶叶的群体生长在一起，我们一行人不知道爬了多少的山路才到的龙井村，那里面的人很好客，随便找了个农庄吃饭都是要品龙井茶的，不喝茶人家不给你吃饭…………呵呵~~还第一次见到这样的，菜不是很多，但是那里茶叶一般买到的都是次品，建议还是到市面上买茶叶，我们点的是20块钱一杯的龙井，但泡出来叶子好大，味道还是不错的
有点搞不清说的是龙井村，还是村子后面一点的那个龙井问茶，还是御茶园啊，不过都是挨在一起的，我最喜欢龙井问茶，环境实在是太舒服了，简直让人不想走，非常的幽静古朴，坐下来喝杯茶聊聊天一天就这么悠闲的过去了，但是说让我是五一去杭州刷景点去的呢，没呆多久，喝了杯八宝茶，人后就走人了。
从杨公堤一路骑自行车上去，一边欣赏路边的美丽风景一边呼吸着新鲜的空气，在龙井村最里面是老龙井御茶园也简称十八颗，里面有乾隆种的18颗茶树，环境没的说，周末和朋友在这里打牌，喝茶、吃饭都是不错的选择，但是需要提前预定，在御茶园外面也有很多农家菜，味道也都不错的。
导游手册上说出绿茶的有名地方龙井那里有一口不会枯竭的井,于是我就去找了。树林那里确实有口井,可是也仅此而已,不必特地来观光。路边有很多向游客兜售龙井茶的人。回去的时候找巴士找得很辛苦。

我们到那里的时候还在下雨我的父母可以不走得很好。 我自己做了一个快速打开。 有个漂亮的大自然和洗手间,都是令人难以置信的干净。 不要嘲笑我。 是的,厕所! 当您在中国旅行是很重要的。

杭州惊人的 -- 这是一个多么美丽的城市！ 而且,在中国,这是一家Shining Star！ 但是,到目前为止,最好的部分是,我们的旅行和远足,通过一个茶茶Cultural Village Mountain结尾的。 这是一个可爱的小村庄,似乎没有过度开发的旅游Y Ness的一些在中国的其他地方。 我们吃了一顿非常好的（我只希望我能记住餐馆的名字了）,非常美味,可能是整个旅行中最棒的（还可以。 我可能也已经很饿了山远足之后）。 虾做的绿茶Leaves很棒！ 是的,那里的卖东西的人（在中国的位置吸引游客）,但是很少,比在其他地方。
其实Village不是很吸引人,但是漫步在茶plantages很棒。 漂亮的景色。 您可以轻松地从村子里去远一点的地方,小溪Paths Nine。 还不错。
龙井茶村确实是一个迷人的地方太宁静漂亮的绿色！ 真正值得去杭州如果来中国旅行的不会让你失望的该有的都有特别是去茶园。 他们还提供下午茶品尝牭比。
龙井茶（龙井茶）的家, 而且还很长知识了解如何茶种植和收割在这里。 它坐落在一个小村庄的外面就是杭州。 我很能聊的人和他们说这是一家当地的夫妻开的最好的茶在中国只能得到最好的一家特别的茶。 我们发现这里的价格茶很$$$但是我们有机会学习如何喝这个茶和所有的意思, 很新鲜。 如果你真的很想买, 他们会在你的面前新鲜的茶包。 再次, 这茶艺术和工厂主要是针对游客。

那么, 你知道中国是一个国家有深厚的茶文化与中国有很大的热情 endowded 茶就像西方人有咖啡。 当然他们有更多的激情的好茶达尔维什。 因为是很久都没有, 龙井茶品尝全国和全世界的, 但是在杭州龙井茶本身的味道是最好的由于犂嗨载列及度身订造的气候。 至于这茶村, 我想说的是这将是一个保守的说法, 一说它风景如画。 因为我第一次进入村庄, 知道我是发生： 哇, 这真是一个理想的休息和花在后来的几年。

我和朋友骑了大约10公里从酒店到村子里, 在一个古老的中国女士住在酒店附近的建议克劳伯勒。 旅行很棒, 有很多景点都在路的两边（唯一的问题就是有很多上坡, 而不是所有的我们能够征服我们租自行车）, 还有一个很好选择公共交通的主要道路很石旗座套摺。 村子很小, 还有茶楼搪层的道路。 我们尝试了一些龙井茶 - 我的意思是, 在杭州, 杭州的 iANS 要做什么 - 还有一个很好的聊了一些小购买茶叶的芬芳的同时让花枝招展。 总之这是个很好的远离所有的喧嚣和主要的西湖景点。
伟大！ 一个安静的田园地方！ 有一个大概有800亩的高山茶园。 一个绿色的毯子的新鲜茶！ 你也可以和他们约有密切联系。 有很多茶馆在那里你可以品尝茶和了解茶知识从当地的人。
我希望这是我们看到的茶村杭州的权利都选择这里的原因是因为它很漂亮但是如果长在山上。 女人有篮子他们的备份选择茶在风景如画的山丘。 摄影师的梦想, 无论怎么看都是很适合拍照, 真希望我能在这里住更久。 绿茶也很好, 买了很多带回去。 很洁净。
后去西湖。 我和我丈夫在一个早上骑自行车穿过茶园。 他们更漂亮的湖和那么拥挤。

text.wiki:
The Untamed  (Chinese: 陈情令; pinyin: Chén Qíng Lìng) is a 2019 Chinese television series based on the BL xianxia novel Mo Dao Zu Shi by Mo Xiang Tong Xiu, starring Xiao Zhan and Wang Yibo. The series follows the adventures of two soulmate cultivators who travel to solve a series of mysteries, eventually finding and defeating the true culprit. It aired in China on Tencent Video from June 27 to August 20, 2019. A 20-episode special edition of the drama aired on WeTV starting December 25, 2019.


== Synopsis ==
,Sixteen years in the past, the jianghu world is ruled by the powerful Wen sect, which dominates over the smaller Lan, Jiang, Nie, and Jin sects. The cheerful, mischievous, carefree Wei Wuxian, adoptive son of the Jiang clan, becomes fast friends with the righteous and duty-minded Lan Wangji during an educational seminar hosted every year at the Lan clan's compound. Things become complicated when, during their adventures, the pair find out that the head of the Wen sect is the evil mastermind behind a series of plots that would wreak havoc upon the lands.
In the present, Wei Wuxian is universally reviled as a practitioner of the dark arts; despite having been presumed dead for almost 16 years, he is portrayed as a vicious, bloodthirsty monster and his name is used to frighten children. Mo Xuanyu, the badly-abused nephew of the Mo clan head and the only cultivator in his otherwise mundane clan, uses a dark ritual to summon the spirit of Wei Wuxian into his own body and bind him with a curse that forces Wei Wuxian to punish Mo Xuanyu's enemies. While Wei Wuxian struggles to figure out what has happened in the world since his death and complete his curse-enforced mission, he ends up encountering Lan Wangji. The two work together to solve a series of murder mysteries, eventually finding and defeating the true culprit.


== Episodes ==
The series aired every Thursday and Friday (GMT +08:00) with two episodes each, and VIP members could have early access to two more. On the first day of its release, a total of six episodes were available to VIP members. On June 30, 2019, their official Weibo released a new schedule and shifted the release from Monday to Wednesday. The series ended on August 20, 2019 with the 50th episode. On July 29, 2019 during an official fanmeeting event, they announced that VIP members would be able to watch all the episodes on August 7.


== Cast ==


=== Main ===


=== Supporting ===


==== Gusu Lan Sect ====


==== Lanling Jin Sect ====


==== Qinghe Nie Sect ====


==== Qishan Wen Sect ====


==== Yunmeng Jiang Sect ====


==== Yi City Arc ====


==== Others ====


== Production ==


=== Pre-production and filming ===

Pre-production of the drama took two and a half years; including writing and modifying of the script, establishing the world view structure and art concept, as well as building of sets. The project was first announced in March 2018.The series is co-directed by Zheng Weiwen and Chen Jialin; and the script written by a team consisting of Yang Xia, Deng Yaoyu, Ma Jing and Guo Guangyun. The main producers are credited to be Fang Feng, Yang Xia, Wang Chu and Liu Mingyi; while Yang Xia and Ji Peng serve as the art directors. The drama was filmed from April 2018 to August 2018 at Hengdian World Studios and Guizhou. Two weeks before filming, the cast gathered for script reading sessions and underwent martial arts and etiquette training.Due to the censorship in China, all BL content is removed from the drama and changes are made to the overall plot. As the original novel was written in a "flashback" style, additional scenes had to be inserted to improve the flow of the story. 
Two versions of the script were prepared; one is told in the chronological order of story development, and the other is a narrative trajectory that follows the original novel. Finally, on the basis of not breaking the core of the original story, and to fully develop and layer the storyline, the team decided to adopt a mixture of both styles. To better fuse the different storylines together, the team decided to forgo traditional styles of filming, and more suspense was used in the lens composition settings.Despite being termed as "xianxia" drama, The Untamed includes many elements of traditional wuxia dramas, fused with a new style. Using traditional wuxia values such as "chivalry and courage", it allows the younger audience to better relate to the drama.


=== Casting ===
The casting director gave a special "character card" to each of the cast members; which includes detailed descriptions of the character such as the looks, height, clothing style and even specific details such as "Wei Wuxian has a natural smiling face".Xiao Zhan and Wang Yibo were announced as the lead actors in April 2018. Xiao Zhan was recommended by a friend of the producer Yang Xia, who chose him because of his "clean gaze". Wang Yibo got the role through an audition, because of his "natural coldness".Lu Zhixing and Bian Jiang, who dubbed Wei Wuxian and Lan Wangji in the audio drama and donghua adaptation of Mo Dao Zu Shi respectively, were hired to voice Wei Wuxian and Lan Wangji in the series.


=== Design and concept ===
According to producer Yang Xia, while designing the sets and costumes of the different sects, the team started out by searching for a culture placement where the design could be based on. The costume designer of the drama is Chen Tongxun.For the Gusu Lan sect, influence from the Song Dynasty were taken into consideration while designing the costumes and sets. While designing the "jingshi", blue and green shades were used to showcase the elegance and dignified strength/character of the sect; while darker shades of wood were used to show off the magnificence. Cascading collars and sleeves were used to design the clothes, to highlight the strictness of the sect.For the Yunmeng Jiang sect, influences from the Hubei and Jianghan district were taken. Warm and light colors were used to showcase the cheerful and free-spirited nature of the sect. The architecture and sets were designed to be widely spaced, and yarn was used to create the feeling of "transparency". Narrow sleeves and neat designs were used to highlight the "wandering pugilistic" feel of the sect. A water recycling device was used in the lotus lake of the set, allowing ripples to be seen on the lake surface. A special ceiling was built for the ancestral hall.For the Qinghe Nie sect, the set was designed to be surrounded by high walls and the entrance isn't easily seen because it was often invaded by Qishan Wen sect. For Qishan Wen sect, designs from the Shang dynasty were used. For Lanling Jin sect, the designs were inspired by the luxurious and elegance of the Tang dynasty.


=== Controversies ===
A fire broke out at on July 11, 2018 while the cast and crew were filming in Nanma, Dongyang, at a facility that belongs to Hengdian World Studios. The fire reportedly spread as wide as 300 square meters, and resulted in the death of two crew members.During filming, a rumor surfaced that the producers of the drama had replaced Lan Wangji as Wei Wuxian's love interest with a female character, Wen Qing. This rumor caused significant backlash amongst fans of the original novel. The production team strongly denied such claims.On July 29, 2019, Tencent announced that VIP users have the option to pay in order to watch episodes that have not yet aired. Starting from August 7, the final episode will be released early for some viewers who choose to avail the option. This has caused outrage among viewers of the show, who were concerned that this would open up the risk of the ending being spoiled and also the possibility that the episodes will be pirated, which will then have a negative effect on views. In response, Tencent explained that in this way, they can cater to demands of certain viewers who are requesting for episodes to be released faster while the rest can still watch the series at their preferred pace.


== Soundtrack ==
The main composer of the soundtrack is Lin Hai. The theme song was titled "忘羡" (pinyin: Wàngxiàn) before being renamed from Episode 11 onwards to "无羁 (pinyin: Wú jī;)". On July 8, 2019, the digital album was released on QQ Music along with full version of the song as well as other character songs. The instrumental album was released on QQ Music on August 5, 2019.The physical album was released on November 2, 2019.
On August 19, QQ Music announced that the sales for the soundtrack album had broke fifteen million copies, officially attaining the platinum certification. As of September 2019, the album was the highest-selling soundtrack album on the platform, and ranked #15 on the list of highest-selling digital album.


== Reception ==
The series has a 8.3 rating on Douban; and has the highest number of reviews for China dramas. The series accumulated a total of 8 billion views on Tencent, as of May 2020. One of the major reasons for the series' popularity is its faithfulness to the original novel. 
It was praised by People's Daily for its "wonderful presentation of Chinese characteristics"; showcasing traditional cultural elements through exquisite costumes, traditional Chinese music instruments; as well as transmitting positive values such as courage, chivalry and love for one's country. China News Service similarly highlighted the exquisite costumes and showcase of traditional etiquette, while also praising the suspenseful plot and well-connected storyline. Wang Yibo was initially criticized by viewers for his blank acting style in the first few episodes, which he later improved upon with the help of director instructions.The show has also garnered significant exposure and popularity globally for its strong plot, well-rounded characters, and elaborate clothing, makeup and stage production. Film Daily described the drama as a "Global Phenomenon," and credited it for contributing to the increased presence and popularity of Asian content on popular streaming sites such as Netflix. It has a score of 9.8 on Viki and 9.4 on MyDramaList, making it the highest-rated Chinese TV series on the platforms. It ranked #36 on Tumblr's Top Live-Action TV list of 2019, becoming the first Chinese TV drama to ever enter the chart.
The heroic story with modern values was said to have struck a chord globally, and helps promotes Chinese style and traditional culture to the world, leading to a wave of interest in Chinese dramas.


=== Economic effect ===
The Untamed is said to be the highest-earning drama of 2019, bringing in profits of more than 97.87 million yuan (as of August 15, 2019), with earnings from fan meetings, concerts, streaming platforms, album sales and merchandise.As VVIP members are allowed watch the final episodes of the show in advance, more than 2.6 million new and existing subscribers paid to unlock the function, generating more than 78 million yuan in profit. More than 1 million copies of the soundtrack album were sold. In addition, a merchandise store was opened in Taobao and official merchandise was sold, with earnings amounting to 1.17 million yuan. Other source of earnings include paying to unlock the full music video of "Unrestrained" in advance, as well as the Bazaar Magazine featuring both lead actors Xiao Zhan and Wang Yibo which sold more than 330,000 copies within three days, before exceeding 1.1 million copies.A special system was introduced by Tencent, where VIP members have to accumulate "star points" to get a better chance to get tickets to the fan meetings and concerts. More than 326.7 million people paid 30 to 50 yuan to view the live broadcast of The Untamed National Style Concert on Tencent Video. It is estimated that the platform has earned more than 100 million yuan in revenue. Tickets of the concert were sold-out in less than 5 seconds, and leftover tickets were also marked up to 150,000 yuan by ticket scalpers from the original price of 627 yuan.In overseas markets, Tencent announced in October 2019 that The Untamed had boosted WeTV's growth by 250 percent with an average of 1 million application downloads per month since the drama was first launched in June.Responding to the demand of sold-out fan meets in Thailand and China, in January 2020, the cast members embarked on a multi-city worldwide fan meet tour. Cities included Bangkok, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh City, Tokyo, Seoul, Macau, Kuala Lumpur, Toronto, Los Angeles, New York.


== Awards and nominations ==


== Promotion ==


=== Thailand Fanmeeting ===
The fanmeeting was held in Bangkok at Impact Theater on September 21, 2019 and was attended by 9,000 fans.
The proceeds of the Thailand fanmeeting were donated to the people of Ubon Ratchathani Province, which had been hit by floods.


=== The Untamed National Style Concert ===
The concert was held from November 1 and 2, 2019 at Nanjing Qing'ao Sports Park with a capacity of 20,000 seats. Tan Yizhe served as the music executive of the concert, while Yuan Jing served as the creative director. Ticket prices were sold at 627 yuan and 1980 yuan, to commemorate the first day of broadcast and the last day of filming of The Untamed respectively. 16 songs were sung in the concert, along with a segment for interactions and games. Prior to purchasing tickets on Maoyan, fans had to answer a questionnaire based on the show. Viewers were able to live-stream the concert via Tencent Video, with a fee of 30 to 50 yuan.


=== Mobile game ===
A mobile gamed based on The Untamed is set to be released via NetEase.


=== The Untamed Boys ===
The six-membered group named "The Untamed Boys" (Chinese: 陈情少年), which consists of Yu Bin, Ji Li, Cao Yuchen, Zheng Fanxing, Song Jiyang & Li Bowen, first made their appearance in The Untamed National Style Concert performing the song "Fearless". They subsequently appeared in T Mall 11/11 Shopping Festival, performing the song "Fairytale"; as well as featured in Elle Men's New Youth magazine. They appeared in the variety show Youths Learning In Progress (Chinese: 少年听学中), which aired on Tencent Video starting December 5, 2019.


== International broadcast ==
The drama is broadcast via WeTV in several countries such as Thailand, Vietnam, Philippines, India and Indonesia. It is streamed internationally via platforms like Viki, ODC and YouTube.The drama is broadcast in South Korea via Channel Asia UHD starting from October 21, 2019. It was broadcast in Japan via Asia Dramatic TV from March 19, 2020.The drama has been translated into 11 different languages and broadcast via Netflix in North and South America, Europe, Australia, Philippines and India starting October 25, 2019.


== Spin-off films ==
Up to three films will be released, which will serve as a spin-off to the television series.


=== The Living Dead (2019) ===
The Living Dead (Chinese: 生魂; pinyin: Shenghun) was released on iQiyi on November 7, 2019. It is directed by Qiu Zhongwei, written by Lu Ping and produced by Yang Xia. The movie focuses on the story of Wen Ning and Lan Sizhui.


==== Synopsis ====
Near Qishan Mountain, there is a little town called Fu Feng, which is nicknamed the "City That Never Turns Dark". This city is home to the legend of the "Lit Lamp Murderer". Wen Ning arrives at Fu Feng, and he realizes the abnormality of the town. The whole town is filled with only the weak and sick; and is very run down. When the night arrives, Wen Ning lights up a lamp to attract ghost shadows. Just as he is about to capture them, a ray of blue sword light appears and the black shadow disappears. Wen Ning looks up and sees his nephew, Lan Sizhui. Wen Ning and Lan Sizhui decide to work together and solve the mystery to capture the culprit behind the mysterious incidents.


==== Cast ====
Yu Bin as Wen Ning
Zheng Fan Xing as Lan Sizhui
Wang Yifei as Xiao Qing
Gao Han as Xiao Yi
He Longlong as Zhou Zishu


=== Fatal Journey (2020) ===
Fatal Journey (Chinese: 乱魄; pinyin: Luanpo) focuses on the story of the Nie brothers and Jin Guangyao. It was released on March 26, 2020.


==== Cast ====
Ji Li as Nie Huaisang
Wang Yizhou as Nie Mingjue
Zhu Zanjin as Jin Guangyao


== References ==


== External links ==
The Untamed at Tencent Video's official YouTube channel
trip: 免费，免费，免费。要掌握闭馆时间，我记得是下午四点半。里面适合慢慢逛，走之前还可以买一些纪念品。适合所有年龄段的人去参观。
浙江自然博物馆，位于西湖文化广场，可以做地铁来到此地，里面有很多讲解，有时候还有表演，有地球的讲解，有化石，有很多植物，有浙江的全面介绍，非常值得细细品味，带小朋友来学习的好地方。
很棒，可以带小朋友去认植物和动物，有很多不错的标本和化石，还有地球科学，模拟地震，整体设计蛮用心的，值得一去再去。
带着女儿来杭州好几次了，因为住在亲戚家里，靠近西湖文化广场，所以每次都带女儿去浙江自然博物馆。女儿最喜欢二楼的恐龙和三楼黑暗森林，恐龙做得生龙活虎，头、眼睛、前爪和尾巴都会动; 黑暗森林的灯光会时暗时明，小动物在森林里，给小朋友神秘的感觉，好棒！每次都要来玩！推荐家庭游！没有门票，又省钱又好玩！
从我家（信义坊）这里，去位于闹市的（下城区西湖文化广场6号）浙江自然博物馆，最好的选择是坐船，超级顺畅，感觉那个好呀！ 自然博物馆，免费的大课堂，儿子很喜欢。旁边的科技博物馆也非常适合孩子们
我们在下雨天去了。但不幸的是，这个博物馆因雨而关闭！ ！ ！它不是一个露天博物馆，所以不明白他们为何关闭。
第二次去博物馆，因为它没有拥挤，所以更加愉快。我们花了5个小时来游览它，因为我们可以放松一下并了解更多细节。博物馆有一些新的部分，如南极洲和海洋部分。它非常干净，安全性很好。一个注释是不够的英语翻译。如果需要，即使是免费咨询，我也不介意帮助翻译。它作为家庭经验是值得的，因为它对青少年和幼儿非常有教育意义。加上独特而难忘的家庭时间的质量和亲密度是一个宝贵的时间。
博物馆最近可能转移到了新的位置，接近完成。 动物标本剥制动物是美丽的，并在重建的环境中显示出来。   如果您从一楼开始，您可以走过前化石恐龙时代到现代历史。  4级值。隔壁是科学与技术，这是不完整的，所以我们不能玩展品。 浙江省博物馆位于左侧，值得一游。开发区内有一个购物中心，您可以在5楼享用简单的午餐。星巴克在1楼的街道上。 不能与西湖和西溪湿地竞争。但如果你有10岁左右的孩子，当然值得一游。
我带了6岁的儿子和我的妻子。我的儿子对动物和植物有着深刻的了解，尤其是恐龙，因为我们经常在电视上看纪录片，阅读书籍甚至玩游戏。我希望他能够更好地了解动物的大小，并欣赏从史前时代到现在的地球上居住的各种动植物群。这是一次奇妙的经历，他很享受。绕过博物馆两次，我们一共走了3次。 8公里。我的脚很痛，但看到儿子眼中的兴奋，我的心里充满了喜悦。

我参观了博物馆不到2个小时。博物馆很脏，我能感受到它;灰尘很可能是由正在进行的翻新造成的。我建议参观这个博物馆，因为它是FOC，并且有很好的展品。 有一个恐龙部分我觉得非常有趣，因为有2-3个展厅，里面装满了来自陆地和海洋的全身恐龙骨架。还有一个关于恐龙如何灭绝以及地球是如何进化的展览。 最令我震惊的是以性教育为主题的展览。展出了一些半形胚胎。有一个干燥的男性和女性身体以及保存在玻璃咖啡中的男性和女性身体。我认为展示男性和女性生殖器的方式并不那么令人恐惧。我建议博物馆在展览入口处张贴某种警告标志。
没有多少英文，甚至没有拉丁文的恐龙名称，也没有很多展品，主要针对儿童。尽管如此，这是一个短暂访问的好地方。
... 这家博物馆里面有很多可看的,布置一条规定的所有路由。 孩子们一定会喜欢恐龙的灭绝位! 没有什么比得上它对应在纽约,但也不是一个糟糕的地方呆几个小时。 人实在是太多在周末和假期（尤其是）!

这应该是标题为"自然历史博物馆",不是"自然博物馆。" 刚开了一个中国的省级自然历史博物馆在过去几年中。 这就是其中之一。 有几家不错的蜥脚类恐龙化石骨架像Giant峨嵋龙属,一些恐龙的鸡蛋,一个猛犸象骨架,许多古生代三叶虫化石LIKE ,料生物,但是大部分都是模型的古代和现代的野生动物,大部分的大小。 古老的有点虚假的,看起来就像Shark White类人型机器人很棒,他里面有一个纸箱,但如果你有孩子,他们应该深刻的立体模型。 省历史博物馆也在旁边,值得一游。
破旧萧条。 一些最不靠谱的地方动物标本。 一个满是灰尘的室内塑料森林。 最糟糕的是, 真正的死人的尸体躺在德瓦尔特在案件 - 真正的恐怖。 除非你陶醉在伪劣或奇怪的其他地方寻求刺激。

trip: 呈坎在里黄山不远的地方，是一个小小的古镇。不是很建议来。不是很建议来，不是很建议来。 就真的是很小的一个古镇，进去的话要收门票，可以在里面走走看啊可能。如果你不买门票进去之后可以找当地的老阿姨作为导游，会带着你在里面溜达。 江南大概就真的很多这种有山有水的地方，可能是在这里遇到的村民不是很友好，所以对这边印象不是很好。如果有时间可以去其他的景点看看，有很多值得去的。比如徽州古城。就好太多了。
歙县这边真的景点这真的是小众而且优质，虽然今天下了一天雨，但是雨后的徽州更美，整个村落被八座山包围，氤氲的雾气和小雨，让这个古村落更有感觉，比西递宏村这些人多的路线玩起来更舒服，关键是人少。
很正宗的毛豆腐：）还有一众小吃，包括梅干菜饼、腊肉、雪菜饼、糯米酒等等，价格实惠又好吃，北方绝对吃不到的。最后一栋宗祠非常气派，但村子里其实也布满了高墙深院，有几家还可以和村民聊聊天、拍拍照，他们会告诉你政府统一管理私宅，他们却允许一直被住到今天……总体来讲还是值得去的，八卦村的概念国内也比较少有。

充分感受徽派村落，看了很多有代表性的经典景观，特别是进去参观了几个大宅，听着资深导游的解释，了解了宋明清的建筑特色，也对近古代老祖宗的尊敬。对于现在大家推崇的现代建筑西方巴洛特什么的，我们杰出的"龟纹"工艺值得宣传，不止四大发明哦，不仅有舌尖上的中国，还有很多中华历史的瑰宝。古村落及其周围的开发上了一个台阶，商业味道比宏村好很多人也少，舒服。但很多规划…… 这方面日本确实是老师。BTW, 有家中心位置带招牌的毛豆腐确实好吃，与众不同!
带着快两岁的女儿，来徽州踏青看油菜花！一来到古镇，还没开始行程，已经被古镇的宁静，很惊艳景色深深吸引。徽式古建筑群的黑白灰与春天的绿色，油菜花的黄色，那么柔和地融合在一起。才刚来，就喜欢上这了
呈坎八卦村是个值得一游的地方，徽派古村落建筑群在这里集中体现，一路跟着指示牌游览不会走错鹿。这里有很多曾经的名人故居，现今仍保留的很好，可以慢慢游览。 在从入口处的荷花池往景区内走的时候，会有一些村民围过来并一路跟随要求做向导，拒绝后仍一路跟随，实在很烦。
原本比较平和的小镇，因为拍摄《爸爸去哪儿》，现在有了一些名气，开始商业起来。景色还是不错，不过冬天比较萧瑟，夏天湖里都是荷花应该很美，湖中的倒影和村落相映成趣。来这里有很多黄山小吃可以品尝，毛豆腐，推荐大家试试看。
来到呈坎是计划之外的，无意中听出租车司机提起，然后就直接去了，离黄山市区大概一个多小时车程，黄山市汽车客运总站（黄山市屯溪区齐云大道31号，也叫屯溪汽车站）坐直达呈坎的汽车，该车也经过潜口民宅，每天8:00、10:00、14:00、16:00发车。呈坎村内部根据八卦而建，很有特色，村民也很朴实，人流量少，所以可以自在游逛，是个不错的去处。
呈坎八卦村是根据八卦而建，来了两次每次都是不一样的景观，夏初是荷花满湖，虽然没有倒影，但是七月满湖开放荷花又是另一番景色，歙县必去景观。喜欢徽派建筑的人可以来看看。里面几座大宅子很科学的建造，不禁感叹古代人的聪明才智。一千多年的古村落保存完整。值得一去。
这个是徽州最值得去的的一个景点（比棠樾牌坊群和鲍家花园等不知道好几倍）。古建筑保留的还是很好的，美中不足的是池塘的水有点脏，当地村民不怎么友善。所谓的八卦之村也是说说而已。仔细找找一颗四百年的桂花树哈。
黄山除了宏村和西递这二大村落外，还有一些不错的小村落。客人又少，保护的又好。呈坎就是其中之一。我们驱车前往，游客不算多，很多当地的学生在村里画素描。而且购票后，有讲解带我们穿梭在村子里，介绍关于村内一些建筑的故事，比自己瞎逛来的更有意思。村里除了建筑也有一些特色美食提供给游客。喜欢的话可以慢慢逛，慢慢看。
清明节假期第一天来到呈坎，从黄山市汽车客运总站内的黄山市旅游集散中心乘坐到呈坎的旅游专线车旅3路终点站就是呈坎，票价10元。旅三路每小时发一班车，下午最晚一班是16:00.或者乘坐汽车到岩寺，然后换乘私家车。…
位于黄山市屯溪区北的岩寺镇边上，可以从黄山市旅游集散中心坐旅3路到终点站，下车就是呈坎。要注意的是，八卦村夏季的时候晚上5点关门，到了冬季4点半就关门了所以建议一定要尽早参观。107元的门票是略有小贵，不过可在网上事先定好，成人票85左右即可。非常值得欣慰的是，一进大门便有专业导游分批次的讲解，而且角角落落包括“拐弯抹角”的出处都讲的十分清晰，感觉非常有必要，不会造成转一圈什么都不懂的尴尬。
八卦村，里面还有居民在住，所以整体风格非常古朴，徽派建筑，房屋都是非常有年代感，而且商业气息不浓，建议大家去看看，非常好。

重点推荐呈坎，宏村更像个景区，而呈坎呈现在我们面前的就是一个“村”的应有的状态，那里的人早晨会端着个大碗坐在门口吃饭，会在自家编织些竹制品营生。这里没有人们所厌倦的“商业化”，为数不多的旅店完全不影响呈坎的自然和古朴。这里的明清老宅太多太多，一些宅子被化在门票里，但是有更多的老宅供人居住，当地村民也很乐意你踏门而入。很难想象，一个村子现在居然还有多座纵深长达数十米的大祠堂或其遗迹，可以想见当年罗氏家族的繁盛。旅游公司已经介入有好有坏，好几座残破的老宅正在或准备修缮，游客也越来越多，不想呈坎变成又一个宏村。

徽文化与藏文化、敦煌文化齐名，涉及面广又有历史渊源……在村子里待两天，尽管可以参观宋元明清的徽派古宅、品尝地道的皖南土菜，运气好还遇到了村民婚庆……夜宿明代古宅的雕花木床，穿越时光，徜徉在粉墙黛瓦寻常巷陌，融入画卷……可是，越流连，越觉得这仅仅开启了一扇窗……笑称“无坎”，嘻逗春牛，赏梅花初放，赞木雕美伦，品毛豆腐笋衣油冬菜，听罗侍郎吕蒙严世蕃，登临东山一览众川绕村，仰视中堂满目锦绣传奇，主人谈吐从容优雅举重若轻，游客步履徘徊悠哉思古念今……假期有限无奈返程，再次“跌落凡尘”……淘宝《徽文化》等书籍，与好友分享照片心得并相约下一次的呈坎重游……
是个古镇 说是八卦村 会迷路什么的 其实也就是个噱头 不过碰到一个九四年的导游挺有意思的 年纪小小知道的知识不少 不容易 里面人比较少的
呈坎是一个古村落，又称八卦村。据说在村中要紧跟导游，否则自己很可能会迷路走不出来。我们在村中见到了许多古民居，雕梁画栋，有一81岁老者说愿以300万出售，还不许拆走，只能留在村里。我们还见识了村中的罗东舒祠堂，高大宏伟，院中400年的古桂花依然枝繁叶茂，郁郁葱葱。殿堂里4根金丝楠木巨柱，称一根就价值3亿元，柱身没有涂油漆，是本色的。许多人都冲着它的价值，抱柱留影。
游人比宏村少多了，但是值得去。我的是最标准乘车路线（2011年8月的，是对比好以后的最可行的）屯溪汽车站——岩寺汽车新站——岩寺汽车北站——呈坎，从新站到北站要做当地统一的三轮红色机动车，5元。北站去呈坎的班车每小时一班。大门的水面污染较严重，水面都红了。建筑很有特色。
无意中逛到了这个小村子，这个小村子我觉得最好是要个解说员的，因为里面有很多文化底蕴的东西，自己看的话，是注意不到的，特别是村子里最后的那个宗祠，非常震撼。没想到这个偏僻的小村庄里面居然还有这么特别，这么恢弘，这么精致的建筑群！
呈坎座落于山群中的一处平原，可以选择乘坐从黄山市区开出的短途定点来往于黄山-呈坎的客车。大约每隔15分钟就有一班，快捷而且便宜，并且可以很舒适的享受沿途风景。至呈坎后，门票为80元，凭学生证的确可打折。最好请一位导游，只需20元即可。景点很美也有很多故事可以从导游那里了解。如果你恰巧碰到一户居民家门口摆着“土豆饼 一元一个”，建议你不妨尝尝，自家新鲜制作，味道美味。
呈坎村，原名龙溪，整个村落按<<易经>>“阴(坎)呈(阳)二气统一，天人合一”的八卦理论选址布局，其中最经典的景点是贞静罗东舒先生祠，实在难以想象在如此皖南山区的小村镇能有这么气派的建筑群，比较国内一些古县衙及北京故宫等地，民间建筑能达到如此标准，惊讶感叹之中。不过景区周围的环境还需整治，比如公厕的建设，旅游商业网点与一般商业网点的布局调整。
没有宏村那么大吧。。。但是它透露出和宏村是不一样的味道。。或许淳朴味更浓一些。。。在这里度过了三天。。感受到了很不一样的人情风味。。。

城坎村保留着明朝（公元1368年至1644年）的住宅建筑。城坎村也被广泛称为八卦村（??），与太极哲学有关，主要集中在阴和阳两个方面。在许多旧住宅中都可以看到这一点。强烈建议您雇用一名指南。如果您会说中文，则可以在村口租用当地向导，费用为50元人民币（向导将带您穿越村庄，并向您介绍很多风水建筑设计。游览时间约为1一个小时，如果你想花费超过50元人民币）。当地村庄的英语导游非常有限。虽然您可以自己游览该村庄，但很多文化知识在没有人解释的情况下会丢失。虽然这不像宏村和西递那样吸引游客，但绝对值得一游。
我们被导游带到了成坎村。这是一个阳光灿烂的日子，湖面看起来很美。我们徘徊了几个小时，尝试不同的饺子，煎饼和其他小吃。我们看到了木雕和传统的烹饪方式。这些建筑物最有趣，我们去参观了一个富裕家庭的老房子，里面有一些巨大的木柱，这些柱子有着迷人的历史。
非常宁静的位置，在古老的村庄，湖景和水中的莲花植物。狭窄的小巷经过许多工艺品商店，雕刻精美，值得一游。
成坎是着名的汾水村。由八卦风格设计，虽然我看不到整个村庄的景色，但房子和巷子内部也很有趣。宝伦内阁也令人印象深刻。很适合参观
??建筑在传统中是独一无二的，人们可能会参考重磅炸弹，????。更重要的是，成坎是今天中国最后一个根据300年前的八卦（八卦）建造的乡镇。由于村庄本身是根据八卦建造的，如果你打算在里面冒险，最好找一个当地导游。
我们有一位名叫托尼的导游来自Top China Tours，他们对这个地方和英语都非常了解。你需要知道你在看什么，历史是很重要的。主楼就像一座迷宫。如果你不知道从哪里去小巷内的小巷，它绝对是迷人但容易错过的东西。留出足够的时间并取水。
美丽的农村。如果您在这里或宏村之间有选择，那么一定要选择这里。它更具吸引力，但因为它更加孤立，所以游客少得多。一些老房子向公众开放，当然还有商店和街头小吃摊。但同时远没有“旅游观光”。有用的导游。
发现古建筑非常值得参观。如果您对历史感兴趣，可以特别注意。轻松步行但舒适的鞋推荐。
你会注意到的第一件事就是土地的时候不会有很多游客都会住在这里的经验是非常关键的这家酒店。 但这里的建筑风格相当惊人的照片背景不如其他村庄。 因为许多商店和纪念品的所以也没有带来如此之水。 如果你有一些额外时间家店后,参观村庄和一眼的古代生活。

当我们在一个周二的下午,游客密度比较低。 第一次的'半'能到村子的一部分,就像一个电影,保留了,以往相关,但这不是一个适合居住的地方有一个完整的 - 客人上车时间与他们的生活。 这家酒店的设计是基于的一部分。 B gu（道教八个符号）原则,和我们的司机称之为b gu村庄。 非常风景如画的和令人愉快的散步。 我们碰到的每个人看起来像是租的房间,几乎就是在一个酒店的风格还有一个检查 - 前台和所有。 第二个'半'的就到了去的时候的部分村庄,有全套的 - 住户。
我们来到了这个地方去了黄山。 这个地方非常引人 - 让人赏心悦目,同时提供建筑和自然美景。 由于游客较少流量,你真的可以看到村里的人每天都生活在这里。 人们都很友好,但是他们中的一些还想装在自己的口袋里通过提供不必要的服务（因为感动未来或使之旅中国虽然我们不会说中文的）。 总之,强烈推荐给那些喜欢安静和更真实的地方。
相比其他香港的酒店如辣辣寿司和村庄,这是商业化的活动和不那么拥挤。 这允许您在深度体验村庄和他们的公寓生活。
这个小镇是一个必去的地方,我们租了一辆出租车司机看到我们一点都不失望和Y200 4城市
很酷和信息窗口显示的景象可追溯到过去。 有很多古老的建筑保留所有在这一个村庄。 很"值得"去看看。

text.wiki:
Hangzhou Museum, formerly "Hangzhou History Museum", is a national first-grade museum in Hangzhou, Zhejiang, China.


== History ==
Hangzhou History Museum was established in 2001. It was reconstructed and reopened as Hangzhou Museum on June 9, 2012. Later Hangzhou Museum became a national second-grade museum.
On 18 May 2019, it was promoted to a national first-grade museum.


== Exhibition ==
The museum primarily showcases the history of Hangzhou. Its permanent collection includes relics from many eras, including works considered to be national treasures. There is a hall dedicated to stamps, and another displaying works of calligraphers and painters from the region as well. The museum has incorporated many elements of modern technology. It also hosts temporary exhibits.

		
		
		
		
There are hundreds of models of food, including pastries made during the Song Dynasty, 800 years ago.


== See also ==
National first-grade museums of China


== References ==


== External links ==
Official website
Hangzhou Museum on Sina Weibo (in Chinese) (registration required)
